name: getMssqlMount
description: Returns detailed information for the specified Live Mount of a SQL Server database.

id.description: ID of the Live Mount to fetch.

$ul: **creationDate**: The date this mount was created.
**mountedDatabaseId**: ID for the mounted SQL Server database, once it is available.
**mountedDatabaseName**: Name for the mounted SQL Server database.
**ownerId**: ID of the user who created this mount.
**ownerName**: Name of the user who created this mount.
**date**: Recovery point specified in ISO8601 format, such as "2016-01-01T01:23:45.678".
**recoveryForkGuid**: Recovery fork GUID of the recovery point. If not provided, the recovery fork GUID of the latest snapshot is used.
**timestampMs**: Recovery point specified in the form of a timestamp (in milliseconds). Deprecated. Please use 'date' instead.
**status**: The status of this mount. The status is **_Available_** when the database is successfully mounted and ready to use.
**targetRootName**: Name of the top-level object on which the target instance resides.
**rel**: The relation of the destination of this link to the current resource.
